articles.description: Virgil van Dijk heads home deep into extra time to win the EFL Cup for Liverpool in a captivating final against Chelsea at Wembley.
articles.title: Liverpool win EFL Cup with Van Dijk extra-time header

articles.description: Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post as Italy were denied a first win in France during the Six Nations.
articles.title: Garbisi missed penalty denies Italy historic win

articles.description: England's hopes of forcing a series decider fade dramatically in the face of a stirring India fightback on day three of the fourth Test.
articles.title: England hopes fading after India fightback

articles.description: Liverpool's dramatic EFL Cup triumph leaves pundits purring over "Klopp's kids" - and slating "billion-pound bottle-jobs" Chelsea.
articles.title: 'Klopp's kids beat Chelsea's billion-pound bottle-jobs'

articles.description: Luka Modric rolls back the years with a sublime late winner against Sevilla as Real Madrid move eight points clear at the top of La Liga.
articles.title: Modric scores sublime late winner for Real Madrid

articles.description: Paris St-Germain boss Luis Enrique says his side have to "get used to playing without Kylian Mbappe" as the striker was substituted without scoring in the draw with Rennes.
articles.title: PSG must get used to playing without Mbappe - Enrique

articles.description: Inter Milan captain Lautaro Martinez scores his 100th and 101st Serie A goals as the league leaders thrash Lecce.
articles.title: Martinez passes 100 Serie A goals in big Inter win

articles.description: Bordeaux striker Alberth Elis is in hospital after suffering a serious head injury in Bordeaux's Ligue 2 fixture against Guingamp.
articles.title: Bordeaux's Elis in hospital with serious head injury

articles.description: Virgil van Dijk says he is "so proud" to be a Liverpool player after heading in an extra-time winner for the Reds to beat Chelsea in the Carabao Cup final.
articles.title: Van Dijk 'so proud' after heading Reds to EFL Cup glory

articles.description: Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino says his side "need to feel the pain" after losing the Carabao Cup final to Liverpool at Wembley.
articles.title: Chelsea need to feel pain of cup loss - Pochettino
